comment: He is one the best professors I have taken so far... He helps the students as much as he can.. He will give a chance to improve the grades and learning ability. He is really good at the subject. I would definitely recommend to this professor .
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: If you have a change to take him. PLEASE take him! He is the best professor I have ever taken among all CS related courses. This is not a very easy A class but if you give some efforts, you will get an A and also learn a lot of things. He is very gentle and respect his students.

Outstanding Professor! One of the best professors I ever had. You will actually learn a lot of things from his class. If you want to get A with minimum effort , please choose other professor. I prefer to get B instead of learning nothing. His exams are open book, but you will have to understand the concepts in order to do well in the exams.

He really cares about all of his students, gives study guides for his exams and 200 pts. extra credit. There is a lot of work in the class but you will learn a lot if you put in effort, and getting an A is very doable! Just be prepared to work hard, and he really likes when you email him. :)

His lectures are great and will cover material over and over until he firmly believes the class understands. His tests are challenging and you will take the full time to finish. Easily accessible via email, and will work with you until you understand. His scheduling can be erratic, so keep track of the course calendar and dropbox due dates.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Course was not planned. Class assignments were posted on the fly with due dates that were often unreasonable. Class has no pre-req's yet you must know C++. The professor doesn't know C++ and will send you to the lab if you have questions. Tests are essay style so that he can curve the grade as he sees fit. Work hard pass and learn nothing.

Dr. Jung is tough, but you will enjoy his lectures... he is not dull. His exams are difficult, but he's quite fair when grading. If you come to class, read the text, do the problems he assigns, and study for the exams, you will do well. You will not get an easy A with Dr. Jung, but if you get an A, you earned it and you will know the material.

Data Structures with Jung was good and informative because he prepared the material before class and his tests were reasonable with a study sheet too the Labs were not too diffcult and one of the better CS teachers at SPSU.
Dr Jung is an awesome professor, I learned a lot in each class I have taken with him. He is passionate about the material and is fair with his grading. Ample opportunity for extra credit.

Dr. Jung is among the best at the School of Computing. I had him for Real Time Systems. He respects his students. He puts the learning into context with reasonable expectations. He inspires student participation. I'll also note that he is not an native English speaker, but he always ensures his students understand even if he doesn't know the words.

Computer Networks.  Excellent class, but not easy.  The labs tend to be above the level of comprehension that the course will give you, but the tests are on concepts and if you get it you'll do well.  Study his sample tests, if you get those concepts you'll do well on the actual tests.

Computer Organization Architecture.... He is awesome, explaining concepts very clearly. Has an accent, but who doesn't?? He speaks perfect English. Quizzes are easy enough to get a passing grade. You have to go over his learning modules. My final say is: Master the Learning modules and come to class...you Got an 'A', worst case scenario... 'B'.
Overall, an okay professor. You HAVE to study in order to do well. Ask questions if you need help
